required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Intrauterine Insemination in Patients With Endometriosis I-II
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Intrauterine Insemination in Patients With Endometriosis I-II

brief_summary.textblock: Intrauterine insemination (IUI) is an ART that provides good results in selected patients, improving their reproductive prognosis. Endometriosis I y II, according to ASRM classification, remains an indication to perform IUI. This indication is on continuous debate, considering that different studies have shown controversial results about it, due to the poor reproductive outcomes in this group of patients

primary_outcome.description: to compare pregnancy rate between Endometriosis I-II patients (according to ASRM classification) vs. control group (patients without endometriosis) going under an IUI cycle

arm_group.arm_group_label: Endometriosis I y II, according to ASRM classification
arm_group.description: Cycles were chosen for analysis only when all the following selection criteria were satisfied: < 38 years old women, antral follicle count > 6, basal FSH < 10mUI/ml, BMI<30, Infertility time <4 years, absence of uterine malformations, endometrial polyps or myomas, absence of known thrombofilia, normal kayotype, < 3 previous IUI cycles, no male severe factor associated

Cycles were chosen for analysis only when all the following selection criteria were satisfied: < 38 years old women, antral follicle count > 6, basal FSH < 10mUI/ml, BMI<30, Infertility time <4 years, absence of uterine malformations, endometrial polyps or myomas, absence of known thrombofilia, normal kayotype, < 3 previous IUI cycles, no male severe factor associated

intervention.arm_group_label: Endometriosis I y II, according to ASRM classification

study_pop.textblock: We analyzed the database (SIVIS) containing information on IUI treatment cycles carried out at the IVI-Clinics between 2011 and 2017.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:< 38 years old women, antral follicle count > 6, basal FSH < 10mUI/ml, BMI<30, Infertility time <4 years, absence of uterine malformations, endometrial polyps or myomas, absence of known thrombofilia, normal kayotype, < 3 previous IUI cycles, no male severe factor associated
Exclusion Criteria:
- > 38 years old
